comments.commentBody: Trump is spinning out of control and certainly looks under his bed three times a day looking for espionage devices.  His paranoid personality is not suited to Washington, D.C. antics and gossip.  He will loose his mind wondering about red or blue tie (today) and how much Propecia to take this week.  My more serious guess is that he is in deep dung regarding Russian money and promises made to Mr. Putin.  To poke the Obama team is like stirring a nest of hornets as they know everything and can be pushed only so far before they blast Trump foursquare onto the steps and chambers of the Supreme Court.   I suspect that Trump might need someone smarter than Kelleyanne to keep him from the hoosegow.

Treat this lastest outrageous broadside from Trump with the respect it deserves. Exactly one hour later he tweeted about poor ratings cancelling 'The Apprentice'. The man is not well and The Republican Party refuse to admit.

The only person who could be accused of sabotaging the Trump presidency is Mr. Trump himself. The president appears to have a very weak hold on his own sanity - and the description of his mood as "volatile" before he lefty for Florida is chilling.

Donald Trump proves once again to the world that the man in charge of the US and the free world is mentally ill, not to be trusted, and a Russian puppet.  This was all apparent in the months leading up to the November election, how to we explain his rise to power to the rest of the world and future generations of Americans.

Once again President Trump is sending out a "shiny object" tweet in order to divert press attention away from another subject that is causing him grief. This week the pesky subject is Russia and the AG's lying testimony.  Growing calls for the AG's resignation produces a bombastic tweet.

The times of these agitated, typo-riddled paranoid T-bombs are always interesting. Here is a man who can't be alone with himself, to contemplate, exercise, correspond in the old-fashioned way, make coherent plans, watch a sophisticated film, learn about who his staff are as people, or, God forbid, read. If he's awake, and he always seems to be, he is tracking shiny objects and sniffing out treachery in the kingdom. Sad? Only if he weren't our president.
Be careful, please, about the pronouns you use.  "Our" has no place when talking about DJT.

Only a few days ago so many people were praising Trump for finally "acting presidential" during the State of the Union address to Congress. Why? Because he read from a written speech without going off script. That's how low the bar's been set for this presidency.

Now, less than a week later, we have accusations so outrageous, so destructive to our sense of ourselves as a nation, I wonder how many of those people will admit how mentally unstable is the man who occupies the highest elected office in our country.

Trump's political career took rise as the result of his being leader of the birther movement. He never offered proof of his claims of Obama's illegitimate election despite claiming he had such proof. Now he must be held accountable for this latest slander. The world is watching.

He already did that, blaming Obama in his "I inherited a mess" speech (not true).  Trump does not take responsibility for anything, even claiming, "That's what I was told, that's what they told me," as a reasonable excuse for one of his gross alternative facts.

This is an effort at distraction. For a minute we look away from the Sessions testimony, from the Russia story while Trump throws some wood on the fire for his base to warm their hands on. Anti-Obama rants always rally the base. However, the flames will die by the end of the day, and Trump will be back to pacing around Mar a Lago or the White House with phone in hand plotting a new tweet.

I believe it's possible trump is fishing because he is concerned about something he said on a phone call or calls. There is too much smoke that keeps coming up on the Russia issue. There is almost certainly something going on that needs to be further investigated.
It is so concerning that the trump appears to be seriously unhinged and paranoid. Obama has always shown himself to be a person of the highest integrity. For him to be smeared this way with no evidence whatsoever is highly offensive. How long will we have to endure this lunatic that is holding the highest position in our country? And lunatics tend to deteriorate when they're under pressure. This is almost certainly going to continue to get worse.
And someone noted it's only been six weeks!!! Feels like six years!

Sooner or later, the leaders of both parties must come together - shake hands, hug each other, cry together - and agree to a historic, legal course of action to remove a mentally incompetent President of the United States!

As usual, there is an inverse correlation between the rabid insanity of this con man's early morning tweets, and the ever-tightening vise around multiple members of his "administration" and him, and their financial and business ties with Russia. We have yet to enjoy Melania's long-awaited press conference to shed light on her own immigration status; we have yet to hear the "unbelievable evidence" Don the Con claims to have uncovered regarding President Obama's birth, and we have yet to be treated to full, unredacted release of his tax returns, medical records, and so on.  If he had been a Democrat, suffice to say, The GOTP hit parade of sanctimonious liars and hypocrites would have spent tens of millions of dollars already and launched multiple impeachment proceedings.  What have we heard recently? Silence.  What else is new?  The damage already done to this nation, to our government, our environment, immigrants, women, people of color, the LGBT community, and on and on is only just beginning - and the rantings of a paranoid conspiracy-mongering fraud are a deepening stain upon all of us.  This will end very badly. 3/4, 4:44 PM

Let me itemize the damage we are to incur from the following list:
1.HR610 school vouchers;
2. HR899 terminate dept of education;
3.HR861 terminate dept of environmental protection;
4. HR69 repeal rule protecting wild life;
5. HR370 repeal afordable care act;
6. HR354 defund planned parenthood;
7. HR785 national right to work (destroy unions)
8.HR83 mobilizing against sanctuary cities; and
9 HR147 criminalizing abortion.
Is this draining the swamp? You decide.

Trump is very worried.  I wouldn't be surprised if Senator Coon's statement that "there are transcripts," which will clarify the Russian-Trump connections set him off.  With such fears swirling in his head all night, it seems Trump couldn't restrain himself from lashing out, so great is his sense of persecution and concern about what may be revealed.

Trump is once again trying to distract the media, and somewhat successfully, from his team's pre-election Russian engagement.  This type of unsubstantiated accusation against the prior administration is worthy of a Congressional investigation.  If he is lying, he needs to be reprimanded at minimum, and possibly brought up for impeachment due to his pattern of reckless and harmful behavior.

As these tweets are written in panic as investigations are closing on his Russian ties, I wonder when the rats will abandon the sinking ship. When Republican members of Congress and the Senate will start opposing him en masse, that's when we will know that his shaninegans cannot be contained anymore. If that ever happens...

Trump probably based his accusation on some video parody he saw half of on late night TV.

That said, does anyone seriously doubt that all presidents, including Obama, monitor others communications to gain political information and advantage? After all, when patriot Snowden revealed to us the extent of government spying on us all, Obama insisted that his expansion of the effort continue. And no doubt Trump will also do what his predecessors have done and monitor his opponents communications too.

While this is not a matter to be discussed by the President over twitter, especially since it offers no proof to back it up. It brings up the question whether the wiretaps on Trump Tower aimed at discovering illegal activity with Russian banks, were in fact used for political reasons.

Time will tell but it is too early to write off the claims as a total lie, as many are.

It's less the charge--which if supported by evidence would be alarming--than his amateur way of handling it.

The man cannot even spell "tap" correctly. Failing to check spelling does not argue well for his impulse control in a crisis.
I see there is a faction of the electorate that is willing to believe- how did some comedian put it?- the 5:00 am bowl movement tweet.

As many claims are?
Or as many people are doing?

So rightwing talking heads are conflating the report about the Obama WH doing everything in their power to preserve evidence of Russian interference so that the Trump team couldn't destroy it with Obama illegally wiretapping? These guys are absolutely pathetic. Their evidence-free accusations will play with Trump rubes, but just about everyone else is sick of the childish Tweets, total lack of responsibility or accountability and the endless lying of these people. Enough already. They are, as John Dean so famously said, a cancer on the presidency. Just shameful.
The most exhausting presidency. Ever. And it's only week 6.
I agree

Not at all.

What's exhausting about it ? I don't get when people say this.
My grandfather was shot in the head by Sandinistas in front of. Y mother, while Berni, the communist, praised brutal dictators like Daniel Ortega and Fidel Castro.

Nope, Obama didn't tap your phones, Mr President.

The FBI did, approved by one of those "so-called" judges, as part of an on-going criminal investigation into your campaign. And they can't believe what they're finding.
You guys! The Internet *is* perfect! Thank you!

oy.
there are two choices:
1. he's paranoid
2. if he's using breitbart as a key source, he's an idiot.
in either case, he has zero business in that office.
If he is relying on Breitbart, imagine what Bannon tells him directly!
Neither of those are news.

there is a third choice:
3. he is aware of the contents of wiretaps approved by FISA, and he's trying to divert the blame before the you know what hits the wall about his Russian connections
Your conclusion about zero business still holds!
Oy is right!!

You mean like when Obama blamed Bush for the economy over the entire 8 years he was in office?

I doubt very seriously Obama tapped his phones, this seems like another contrived concoction to distract people from what is going on with Sessions.
Nixon redux. As the pressure mounts, the paranoia will escalate. If Russia-gate doesn't take him down soon, a nervous breakdown will.
Too bad Donald trump doesn't drink. He'd have a plausible explanation to all his wild rants. And he might pass out once in a while, giving us a well deserved respite.

Well, yes but you don't know about substance abuse. you've seen that class-act of a doctor " who.wrote up Drumpf's "medical" report.
Seriously, would you be his.patient ?
